summary: The Biliteracy Education Seal and Teaching Act (BEST Act) aims to award grants to states to establish or improve programs recognizing high-level student proficiency in English and a second language, including Native American languages. The bill defines key terms, outlines grant application requirements, specifies allowable uses of funds (administrative costs, outreach, subgrants for teacher development and testing), and mandates reports to the Secretary of Education.  It also authorizes appropriations for the program for fiscal years 2025-2029.
